result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Dennis Martin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court waives Court costs and orders DNA surcharge.
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Dennis Martin Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Deane Martin ck# 025738 sent this date. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, Baldwin PD & Jail. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty, DF: Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:57 p.m.  Set for STC.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 with the domestic abuse and repeater stricken.   Court reviews the Criminal Complaint.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 with the domestic abuse and repeater stricken. Sentencing arguments. Victim rights have been addressed.  Crt orders: 

- DE sentenced to 60 days in the St. croix County Jail with credit for 51 days served
- Court waives the court costs and orders $200 for the DNA Surcharge apply money on file and refund the remaining balance to the payor
- 20 days to appeal

BOND ON FILE.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kayle B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-May SKYPE with the children.

-Defendant may get his belongings with a Uniformed Officer.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Status conference at 03-15-2016 03:00 pm

ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared.  Court called at 3:11 p.m,  ADA Nieskes advises working on resolution.  Continue the STC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:13 p.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's. Filed by ADA Nieskes. hml
Status conference at 01-29-2016 03:00 pm

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM720 and 14CF453:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail. Case called at 1:46 p.m. Court notes this is the day and time to address request from probation agent to add conditional jail time. Agent Anderson is present. ADA Nieskes makes statement and gives recommendations. Atty Gherty gives argument. Defendant just started MRT last week. ADA Nieskes gives statement. Atty Gherty responds and objects to probation departments NC request. If non compliance with conditions of stay, state may request a lift of stay. On 14CF453, Court will order:

-    Impose and stay 60 days conditional jail time with 20 days credit as long as defendant does the following:
   
   - Continue with MRT 

   -  Remain employed

    -  N/C with Ms. Barton or residence

    -  Compliance with AODA plan

    -  Remain in compliance with rules of probation
Bail/bond hearing at 01-11-2016 01:30 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:40 p.m.  Attorney Gherty advises the DE is on a probation hold and a hearing .  Attorney Gherty is asking for a bond modification from a No Contact to a No Abusive Contact.  Attorney Nieskes objects to modification and makes argument.  Court makes a record that Branch 4 is allowed to amend the bond at the probation hearing on 01/11/16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to Modify Bail Conditions. Filed by Atty Gherty. km
Filed by Atty Gherty. km

BOND ON FILE.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kayla B. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-May SKYPE with the children.

-Defendant may get his belongings with a Uniformed Officer.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kayla B. or his children (except for SKYPE).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Staci Lundmark, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail. Defendant is on a PO hold.
